positive.review: God do I miss this game more than anything. My favourite Battle Royale by far. This game will always hold a soft spot for me, genuinely one of the very small peak gaming moments out there.

loved the game when it came out it was absolute the best battle royale game ever i know a lot of people think the same and miss the old h1z1 king of the hill please revert the game back so we can play

Игра «Z1 Battle Royale» предлагает динамичный батл-рояль с постапокалипсисным флером. Графика среднего уровня, но атмосфера выживания передана ярко. Плюсы — быстрый темп, разнообразное оружие и уникальные механики (например, прокачка персонажа). Минусы — частые лаги, слабый баланс и навязчивые микротранзакции. Подойдёт для любителей экшена, но не выделяется среди конкурентов.
e ok iti face toti dracii din lume si poti sa tai copacii cu toporul
i miss this game
good old days
great game
Such a good game.. I miss it
Legal!

My absolute favorite game back then when the Battle Royale "era" was still golden.
Playing this game ranked and try to grind to the highest rank was such a nice time.

Eh, at this point in time it might be tough to find anybody to play with.  But I guess I lucked out.  Had one other player.  Found them, shot them in the face with a shotgun.  Won the match, and now I move on as the victor.
God do I miss this game more than anything. My favourite Battle Royale by far. This game will always hold a soft spot for me, genuinely one of the very small peak gaming moments out there.

loved the game when it came out it was absolute the best battle royale game ever i know a lot of people think the same and miss the old h1z1 king of the hill please revert the game back so we can play

H1Z1: (Now Z1 Battle Royale)

The king that built the throne for others. This was the raw, janky, and incredibly fun pioneer before Fortnite and PUBG polished the formula. Remember drive-by shootings in the Cop Car and the satisfying thunk of the Hunting Rifle? Pure, chaotic magic.

Verdict: A heartbreaking case of "you had to be there." The current version is a shell of its former self, plagued by questionable updates, a dwindling player base, and lost magic. Stick to the fond memories; don't ruin them by reinstalling.

A PUBG Alternative, they are literally the same game with different names. I preferred it when it was called H1Z1 but it's still okay tbh. Don't expect it to be on par with other battle royales like Apex Legends or Fortnite, etc... but if you like the PUBG visual style then you will like this one and vice versa.

Z1 BR is the game where I drop in thinking I’ll survive five minutes, and somehow make it to the final circle with half my squad missing and a car that’s basically held together with hope. Loot is scarce, shots are wild, and every match ends with someone flying through the air like they forgot gravity exists. Brutal, chaotic, and somehow ridiculously fun.

Honestly, havent played this in years, went back now on my new account cause I forgot about it, and in all honesty, it still holds up, sucks that you only really run into 6 different players, but even then its still fun and worth it and I hope it has a resurgence someday and I can see it.

wrong steam account i did actually play this game i promise
to everyones review written after 2018 u can safely ignore it unless u are planning on. well uhm playing the game
unfortunately series of shitty decision making and the f(ortnite) slur happening the games has effectively been left to rot. if u were on this game in 2017 or earlier u know just how amazing this was truly

I’ve spent some time with this game and honestly, it surprised me in a way I didn’t fully expect. I don’t want to sound dramatic, but there’s something oddly satisfying about how everything fits together — not in some perfect, polished “advertisement” way, but more like a game that knows exactly what it wants to be and just… goes for it.

The first thing I noticed is the atmosphere. Every part of the game — the visuals, the sound, the pacing — kind of blends into this feeling that you’re actually inside its world, even if you’re just casually playing. I know that sounds a bit cliché, but it’s true. Sometimes it’s chaotic, sometimes slow, sometimes you’re just wandering around thinking “ok, what now?” but that’s honestly part of the charm. The game doesn’t try to rush you unless it actually needs to.

Gameplay-wise, it has this mix of familiar elements and small twists that keep things from feeling stale. Nothing groundbreaking, maybe, but it all works together in a way that feels natural. There were moments when I thought “yeah, I’ve seen this in other games,” but then the game throws in tiny details or unexpected interactions that make it stand out just enough. It’s the kind of thing you only notice after a few hours, when you start connecting the dots.

Performance has been mostly fine. A little rough spot here and there, but honestly, show me a game these days that doesn’t have something weird happening once in a while. Nothing game-breaking on my end, at least. You can clearly tell the developers put effort into this, even if a few edges are still a bit sharp. Again — part of the charm.

What I really appreciate is that the game gives you space to play the way you want. Some people will rush through every objective, others will take their time exploring or messing around, and both approaches actually feel valid. I like games that don’t punish you for not following some “correct” path.

Overall, I’d say this is one of those titles that grows on you the longer you play. It doesn’t try too hard to impress in the first five minutes — instead it slowly builds its identity, layer by layer, until you suddenly realize you’ve been playing way longer than you planned. If you’re looking for something that balances comfort with challenge, familiar mechanics with fresh touches, and a world that’s just fun to be in, then I genuinely think this one is worth giving a shot.

Would I recommend it?
Yeah, I would — maybe not to everyone, because no game is for everyone, but definitely to anyone who likes getting lost in a game for a bit and discovering things at their own pace.

negative.review: HA NO LOVE
ripulia

This game fell so far from what it used to be. The old H1Z1 was a survival zombie game, but in the world you could loot Battle Royale tickets which enabled you to be able to compete.  I loved that, but i can see why people wanted to just be able to que. However, right when they first made the split, and you no longer looted the tickets, but rather within the same game could either hop on a survival server or play the BR's mode, that's when this game was gold. All kinds of cosmetics, that you could loot from airdrops within the matches. Goddamnit this game was the best in its prime.  I really miss it.
Great game back in the day. Kinda dead now not a lot of people game
We need the old H1Z1 Survival game back, Not this BR, worse decision ever made.

It’s clunky, outdated, and buried under the shadow of games that actually evolved, leaving h1z1 as little more than a historical footnote no one asked to revisit. Playing this now feels more like an archaeological dig, sifting through the ruins of what was once the foundation of battle royales. Unfortunately, the excavation yields nothing but broken mechanics and outdated graphics.
Cant even play it keep getting code G15. cant be arsed to jump through hoops to fix it.
will not let me play SOLO mode - keeps hanging and crashing
i like to poop in my hand and smell it
At this point, just play PUBG
dead game
Paid $5 for this sh*t!
Game is a waist of time. Don't bother.
Ахахахха, кто покупал - даун
Dead Game

just dont
